meanings.definition: To place (a bishop) on a square of the chessboard where it controls the longest diagonal.
meanings.sent1: In the game, I fianchettoed my bishop to control the long diagonal.
meanings.sent2: He always fianchettoed his bishop early in the game.
meanings.sent3: The bishop fianchettoed its way across the board, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her strategic move was like a bishop fianchettoed, quietly but powerfully influencing the game.
meanings.sent5: The way he fianchettoed his bishop was a masterclass in chess tactics.

meanings.definition: Having a bishop placed on a square of the chessboard where it controls the longest diagonal.
meanings.sent1: The fianchettoed bishop was a key piece in his winning strategy.
meanings.sent2: The fianchettoed position gave him a strong advantage in the game.
meanings.sent3: The players were amused by the perfectly fianchettoed bishop on the board.
meanings.sent4: Her position was like a fianchettoed bishop, commanding attention and respect.
meanings.sent5: The fianchettoed bishop stood out among the other pieces, elegant and powerful.
